title: How To Build a Raised Bed Garden

subtasks: Clear the ground of grass and weeds.
Remove existing soil and place hardware cloth on the ground to prevent pests.
Arrange wood logs to form the raised bed structure.
Fill the raised bed with compost materials.

tasks.task: Prepare the materials for the raised bed.
subtasks: Collect compost ingredients (cardboard, kitchen scraps, clay soil, mushroom compost, organic planting soil, perlite, sphagnum peat moss, azomite rock dust).
Manage the slope by arranging logs along the hillside.
Use hardware cloth and cardboard to cover the ground beneath the bed.
Add a layer of kitchen scraps on the cardboard.
Incorporate decomposed soil with compost materials.
Layer mushroom compost, organic soil, perlite, peat moss, and azomite.
Mix all materials thoroughly with a pitchfork.

tasks.task: Align raised beds for specific conditions.
subtasks: Choose partially shaded areas for beds that need less daylight.
Consider the location (north end of garden near fence) for beds requiring shadier conditions.
